definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Sometimes M. Mabeuf started at the sound of the bell.
sentences.chinese: 有時馬白夫先生聽到門鈴響而驚動起來。

sentences.english: When the time, now it still has a my sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 我驚動了韶光，如今它還我一席哀痛。

sentences.english: Gunfire shocked the chief commander Liu Xunde guard.
sentences.chinese: 槍聲驚動了司令長官劉勳德的衛隊。

sentences.english: This second trip fairly aroused the watchers along shore.
sentences.chinese: 小划子的第二趟行程可大大驚動了岸上的守望者。

sentences.english: Wen Xiang never imagined that minor event just now would alarm the top officials.
sentences.chinese: 文祥想不到剛纔那一點芝麻小事，竟然就驚動了層峯。

sentences.english: A few days ago, however, I was disturbed by sounds of laughter wafted through the window.
sentences.chinese: 前幾天，窗外一陣陣的喧譁笑語，驚動了我。

sentences.english: The sound of gun-firing startled Andras and Ilona.
sentences.chinese: 槍的響聲驚動了安德斯和洛娜。

sentences.english: The discovery of that sunken ship rocked the archeology world.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船的發現驚動了考古界。

sentences.english: Their gift is sudden illumination, and it often startles others.
sentences.chinese: 他們的天賦是突然的照明，而且往往驚動其他人。

sentences.english: The whole town was startled by the news.
The clang of the firebell alarmed the village.
sentences.chinese: 火警鈴的叮噹聲驚動了全村的人。

sentences.english: The clang of the firebell alarmed the village.
sentences.chinese: 的鐺鐺聲驚動了全村的人。

sentences.english: I adjure you , o daughters of Jerusalem, do not stir up or awaken love, until it is ready !
sentences.chinese: 不要驚動，不要叫醒我所親愛的，等他自己情願。

sentences.english: She unfastened the latch quietly without disturbing anybody.
sentences.chinese: 她躡悄悄地拉開門閂，沒有驚動任何人。

sentences.english: Several days ago, I was suddenly disturbed by a joyous din from outside the window.
sentences.chinese: 前幾天，窗外一陣陣的喧譁笑聲，驚動了我。

sentences.english: The crashing of the vase startles Rhett Butler.
sentences.chinese: 花瓶的破碎聲驚動了白瑞德。

definition: a period of time/a while/for a short while/temporary/momentary/at the same time
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to run away/to flee in disarray
